channel.title: BlueWave Media Cafe - Kimberly Beaven
channel.description: The Podcast for the Business Professional, BWM Cafe is a fast paced, info packed and fun show that provides creative inspiration, tells how to market your small business, fine-tune your vision, advance your mission and share your passion with the world. We skip the technical code and get to the heart of what it takes to be a small business professional. The show is about getting to the top of your field and dramatically advancing your business and personal development. If you are a fan of Kimberly Beaven and want to start your own podcast, this will also help you promote and develop it. If you create, love business and technology this show is a must listen. This podcast is your absolute best source for learning about Savvy Small Business. www.bluewavemedia.ca

image.title: BlueWave Media Cafe
image.description: Your Best Resource for Savvy Small Business. The podcast that helps you make your marketing dollar go farther and accomplish more.

channel.itunes:author: Kimberly Beaven
channel.itunes:subtitle: The podcast for Savvy Small Business Marketing
channel.itunes:summary: A podcast show about surviving and succeeding in marketing your small business. The Podcast for the Business Professional, BWM Cafe is a fast paced, info packed and fun show that provides creative inspiration, tells how to market your small business, fine-tune your vision, advance your mission and share your passion with the world. We skip the technical code and get to the heart of what it takes to be a small business professional and how to market intelligently. The show is about getting to the top of your field and dramatically advancing your business and personal development. If you create, produce, share or teach, love business and technology this show is a must listen. This podcast is your absolute best source for learning about Savvy Small Business.
channel.itunes:keywords: marketing, small business, media, podcasts, blog, london, kimberly beaven, the blue wave, blue wave media, bluewave media

item.title: 25 BlueWave Media Cafe - Kimberly Beaven
item.description:
Welcome to BlueWave Media Cafe's 25th show. Our host, Kimberly Beaven interviews Michael Kristof, Founder of The Kristof Creative at http://www.kristofcreative.com or Twitter @kristofcreative. We chat about social networks, Twitter, some of our favourite Twitter pals, copyright issues, reputation monitoring and soooo much more.

Credits:
The music today
Intro/Outro: gedgetron by gazaar - an exciting new artist from Tennessee, USA. Visit their website at http://www.gazaar.tumblr.com/

BlueWave Media Cafe supports podsafe music. Thank you for your creative and fresh sounds!

BlueWave Media on Twitter @bluewavemedia

Thank you for joining us, and please send your feedback, thoughts and ideas to podcast@bluewavemedia.ca or visit BlueWave Media Cafe at http://www.bluewavemedia.ca
item.itunes:author: Kimberly Beaven
item.itunes:subtitle: The Podcast for Savvy Small Business - BlueWave Media interviews Michael Kristof Part 2
item.itunes:summary:
Michael Kristof, of Kristof Creative, joins Kimberly Beaven, virtually, in the BlueWave Media Studio for a great discussion about social networks, the design business and so much more. This is Part 2 of a 2 part Interview

Check out Michael’s site at http://www.kristofcreative.com or chat with him on Twitter @kristof. While you are at it, Kimberly is on Twitter @bluewavemedia, and the BlueWave Media site is http://www.bluewavemedia.ca.

Thanks Michael for a great interview!

item.title: 23 BlueWave Media Café - Kimberly Beaven
item.description:
Welcome to BlueWave Media Cafe's 23rd show. Our host, Kimberly Beaven talks about utilizing technology is nothing new for many small business owners. What is new is the vast amount of methods to make contact with your clients. What should you use. How should you use it? Let's chat.

Credits:
The music today:
 Intro/Outro: gedgetron by gazaar - an exciting new artist from Tennessee, USA. Visit their website at http://www.gazaar.tumblr.com/

BlueWave Media Cafe supports podsafe music. Thank you for your creative and fresh sounds!

Thank you to all of our Consultant Clients; we wish you the best success as you utilize technology in your business.

Thank you for joining us, and please send your feedback, thoughts and ideas to podcast@bluewavemedia.ca or visit BWM Cafe at www.bluewavemedia.ca

item.title: 20 BlueWave Media Cafe - Kimberly Beaven
item.description:
Welcome to BlueWave Media Cafe's 20th show. Our host, Kimberly Beaven interviews Mindy Willis, Founder of The Mindful Body and Ayurveda Educator. She is in the studio to talk about her jouney as a Small Business Owner, things she has learned, her thoughts about the future and her advice for other business owners.

Credits:
The music today
 Intro/Ouro: gedgetron by gazaar - an exciting new artist from Tennessee, USA. Visit their website at http://www.gazaar.tumblr.com/

BlueWave Media Cafe supports podsafe music. Thank you for your creative and fresh sounds!

Thank you to Mindy Willis; we wish you all the best as you celebrate four exciting years in business! Visit her website at www.themindfulbody.ca or email her at mindy@themindfulbody.ca

Thank you for joining us, and please send your feedback, thoughts and ideas to podcast@bluewavemedia.ca or visit BWM Cafe at www.bluewavemedia.ca
item.itunes:author: Kimberly Beaven
item.itunes:subtitle: The Podcast for Savvy Small Business - BlueWave Media interview the Mindful Body
item.itunes:summary:
Small business entrepreneurs are busy running around just trying to catch themselves. It's not easy starting a business, and we find out some of the downfalls owners may face on a personal side and business perspective..

Today we interview Mindy Willis from the Mindful Body - Celebrating four years, lessons learned and some great advice.

item.title: 21 BlueWave Media Cafe - Kimberly Beaven
item.description:
Welcome to BlueWave Media Cafe's 21st show. Our host, Kimberly Beaven interviews Patricia Vanderheyden, a psychotherapist in private practice in London. She is in the studio to talk about her new website, global effects on her business and some great words about getting things in balance and dealing with stress. Not that small business owners ever have to deal with stress - yeah, this is timely.

Credits:
The music today:
 Intro/Outro: gedgetron by gazaar - an exciting new artist from Tennessee, USA. Visit their website at http://www.gazaar.tumblr.com/

BlueWave Media Cafe supports podsafe music. Thank you for your creative and fresh sounds!

Thank you to Patricia Vanderheyden; we wish you the best for the holidays and look forward to seeing your global presence grow with your new website! Visit her website at www.patriciavanderheyden.com or email her at patricia@patriciavanderheyden.com

Thank you for joining us, and please send your feedback, thoughts and ideas to podcast@bluewavemedia.ca or visit BWM Cafe at www.bluewavemedia.ca

item.title: 22 BlueWave Media Cafe - Kimberly Beaven - Ambassador London
item.description:
Welcome to BlueWave Media Cafe's 22nd podcast. London Ontario is a wonderful city and BlueWave Media is proud to be a part of her diversity.

Credits: Ambassador London for the video production

Ambassador London is comprised of members of the community at large. We are business people, educators, artists, entertainers, community leaders, students and Londoners from all walks of life. It’s your pride and passion that will raise awareness of all London has to offer. Check out the Ambassador London site to find out more.

This is a video produced for Ambassador London to showcase what London has to offer.

Please visit their website at to find out more

Thank you for joining us, and please send your feedback, thoughts and ideas to podcast@bluewavemedia.ca or visit BWM Cafe at www.bluewavemedia.ca

item.itunes:subtitle: The Podcast for Savvy Small Business - BlueWave Media shows the Ambassador London video
item.itunes:summary: Welcome to BlueWave Media Cafe's 22nd podcast. London Ontario is a wonderful city and BlueWave Media is proud to be a part of her diversity.

item.title: 18 BlueWave Media Cafe - Kimberly Beaven (Non-Enhanced)
item.description:
Welcome to BlueWave Media Cafe. This is our 18th show and we have Hellen Buttigieg as our guest again today. For all of you Creatives out there, this show is for you. How do we get organized and productive, finding the best methods for our business.

Send your feedback to podcasts@bluewavemedia.ca or visit us at www.bluewavemedia.ca

The music today:
 Intro: Nicollette by ST. CHRISTOPHER - a hot band from New Jersey, USA. The band is represented by AERIA Records. Visit their website at http://aeriarecords.com/

Outro: Things I Used to Do by JACQUES GRANT - Texas, USA. Visit his website at http://www.myspace.com/jacquesgrant

BlueWave Media Cafe supports podsafe music. Thank you for your creative and fresh sounds!

Thank you for joining us, and please send your feedback, thoughts and ideas to podcast@bluewavemedia.ca or visit BWM Cafe at www.bluewavemedia.ca
item.itunes:author: Kimberly Beaven
item.itunes:subtitle: The Podcast for Savvy Small Business - with guest Hellen Buttigieg
item.itunes:summary:
Did you know that clutter in your space can hinder your creativity and contribute to stress and lack of motivation? If you’ve tried to get organized in the past using traditional methods but failed, it’s time to take a less conventional approach. Professional Organizer Hellen Buttigieg will show you how to conquer clutter in ways that suit your organizing style so you can breathe a little easier, enjoy a higher level of creativity and be more effective both at home and at work.

Today we focus on Creatives (the visual folks) and help you become more productive, reduce your stress and find methods that work best for you.

item.title: 19 BlueWave Media Cafe - Kimberly Beaven
item.description:
Welcome to BlueWave Media Cafe. This is our 19th show and Kimberly Beaven was interviewed on Today's Londoner on May 10, 2007. This is the audio of that interview. The video will be casted as well.

Send your feedback to podcasts@bluewavemedia.ca or visit us at www.bluewavemedia.ca

Credits:
All of the crew at Rogers Television Cable Inc. and Colin from the Braywick Bistro. Thank you also to Bonnie Baker, who interviewed me and to Jeremy Cook, the show producer at Rogers. 
BlueWave Media Cafe supports podsafe music. Thank you for your creative and fresh sounds!

Thank you for joining us, and please send your feedback, thoughts and ideas to podcast@bluewavemedia.ca or visit BWM Cafe at www.bluewavemedia.ca
item.itunes:author: Kimberly Beaven
item.itunes:subtitle: The Podcast for Savvy Small Business - BlueWave at Today;s Londoner, Today's Q
item.itunes:summary:
Small business entrepreneurs are busy running the day to day operations while trying to get their business know in their local and global markets. We tackle some of the myths and provide an overview for small business marketing.

Today we focus on savvy marketing for small business, including podcasting, websites and some great tips.

item.title: 17 BlueWave Media Cafe - Kimberly Beaven (Non-Enhanced)
item.description:
Welcome to BlueWave Media Cafe's 17th podcast. Today, with host Kimberly Beaven, we have a motivalional guest, Hellen Buttigieg - Did you know that clutter in your space can hinder your creativity and contribute to stress and lack of motivation? If you’ve tried to get organized in the past using traditional methods but failed, it’s time to take a less conventional approach. Professional Organizer Hellen Buttigieg will show you how to conquer clutter in ways that suit your organizing style so you can breathe a little easier, enjoy a higher level of creativity and be more effective both at home and at work.

This is the show you don't want to miss. Take back control of your office, your paperwork and glean some great tips. Visit Hellen online at www.weorganizeu.com, and even sign up for her monthly newsletter jammed packed with tips and ideas.

The music today:
Intro: Nicollette by ST. CHRISTOPHER - a hot band from New Jersey, USA. The band is represented by AERIA Records. Visit their website at http://aeriarecords.com/

Outro: Fallout Renegade by ANEMO - New York, USA. They are reprsented by City Canyons Records.

BlueWave Media Cafe supports podsafe music. Thank you for your creative and fresh sounds!

Thank you for joining us, and please send your feedback, thoughts and ideas to podcast@bluewavemedia.ca or visit BWM cafe at www.bluewavemedia.ca

item.title: 16 BlueWave Media Cafe - Kimberly Beaven
item.description:
Welcome to BlueWave Media Cafe's first mobile podcast, but our 16th podcast. Today, with host Kimberly Beaven, we will talk about small business marketing's basics. First, you need a logo and branding identity. Remember, in order to use that image/logo in your marketing you need an .eps, that can be colour separated, not just a .tiff or .bmp. As well, you need to have a consistent use of that image - on your fax cover sheet, your letterhead, business cards, online and in print ads. It is not about spending a lot of money but just spending it wisely; print two collateral pieces such as flyers together to save on printing costs, or purchase the paper you are going to use through out the year in bulk to save some extra cash. You have set aside money for an actual marketing strategy haven't you? You advertising should be a reflection of you, after all you are your business. There needs to be a "you flavour" in how you market the business. It shoud also be an outpouring of your business plan and mission statement. Your business plan sets the direction in which you will proceed and helps you identify your overall business health. If you haven't made one yet, get to it! Every business needs one! This will also direct you in your product and services that you offer. If a service/product is not profitable, then maybe you need to look at removing or replacing it. Finally, your advertising and marketing should be measurable. You need to know if your hard work is paying off. This is the only way to make intelligent decision on the type, or style of marketing that works for your particular business.
Thanks for joining us, and please send your feedback, thoughts and ideas to podcast@bluewavemedia.ca or visit BWM cafe at www.bluewavemedia.ca
item.author: podcast@bluewavemedia.ca
item.itunes:author: Kimberly Beaven
item.itunes:subtitle: 16 BlueWave Media Cafe- marketing for Small Business, Mobile Podcast
item.itunes:summary: What do small business owners need to remember in their marketing? It's not about cash, it is about quality and results.

item.title: The 2006 Podcast Awards - Advertisement
item.description: It’s that time again, Podcast Awards time! Check out the site and vote for your favourite podcast/podcaster in a variety of categories. One vote per 24 hours, so vote early and vote often (at elast every day). Of course, we would not be at all put-out if you happened to vote for BlueWave Media Cafe, Podcast by Design, or BlueWave Riders. Hint, hint, nudge, nudge.
